#Text=Foreword
#Text=Mr.

#Text=E. D. Malone desires to state that both the injunction for restraint and the libel action have been withdrawn unreservedly by Professor G. E. Challenger , who , being satisfied that no criticism or comment in this book is meant in an offensive spirit , has guaranteed that he will place no impediment to its publication and circulation .

26-2	1069-1070	I	abstract[69]	new[69]	_	_

#Text= There Are Heroisms All Round Us "

column1: #Text=Mr. Hungerton , her father , really was the most tactless person upon earth , -- a fluffy , feathery , untidy cockatoo of a man , perfectly good-natured , but absolutely centered upon his own silly self .
#Text=If anything could have driven me from Gladys , it would have been the thought of such a father-in-law .

#Text=I am convinced that he really believed in his heart that I came round to the Chestnuts three days a week for the pleasure of his company , and very especially to hear his views upon bimetallism , a subject upon which he was by way of being an authority .

#Text=For an hour or more that evening I listened to his monotonous chirrup about bad money driving out good , the token value of silver , the depreciation of the rupee , and the true standards of exchange .

#Text=" Suppose , " he cried with feeble violence , " that all the debts in the world were called up simultaneously , and immediate payment insisted upon , -- what under our present conditions would happen then ?
